## The Story of Seven

Seven huddled in the corner of the number line, his digits trembling. Every time someone approached, he'd shrink back, whispers of “division” and “fractions” echoing fearfully in his mind. He watched as his friends, comfortable and confident, glided through mathematical operations. Five, a jolly chap, was often multiplied, growing larger with each encounter. Three, quick and agile, enjoyed being subtracted, effortlessly shrinking.  Even fearsome one hundred enjoyed being divided, splitting effortlessly into manageable parts.

But Seven, he dreaded division. It meant becoming smaller, breaking apart, losing his wholeness. He imagined himself chopped into uneven pieces, scattered and lost. He couldn't bear the thought.

One day, a wise old Zero approached Seven. "Why do you cower, my friend?" Zero asked gently. "Division is not a monster to be feared, but a tool to explore."

Seven looked up, his digits still quivering.  "But…what if I shatter?"

Zero chuckled, a quiet, resonating sound. "Think of it as a journey. When you are divided, you are not destroyed, but transformed. You become a new set of possibilities, a part of something bigger.”
